result.execSummary:
The defendant Mackenzie R Ruppel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Court dismisses and reads-in an uncharged violation of Bail Jumping from 8/13/2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie R Ruppel

defendant.name: Ruppel, Mackenzie R
defendant.address: 1256 Cedar Street Apt.# A, Oshkosh, WI 54901

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:30 am case called. Defendant Mackenzie R Ruppel in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Johnson concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the repeater enhancer. Court dismisses and reads in an uncharged Bail-jumping charge from 8/13/15. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 4 days WCJ with 3 days credit. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample & Surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

Final pre-trial at 11-03-2015 09:00 am.
Jury trial at 12-03-2015 08:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Mackenzie R Ruppel in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Johnson-no agreement reached. Requests trial be set.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Case Recalled @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Mackenzie R Ruppel in court, appearing via telephone, with attorney Alex E. Johnson, apearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received word from his client and case recalled with telephone appearance authorized.  Warrant withdrawn that was ordered previously today.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of personal appearance today.  Matter to go foward by telephone.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Court warns Def as to future missed Court appearances.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Case Called @ 2:08 PM: Attorney Alex E. Johnson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Just prior to going of record, DA confirmed that Def was released from the Winnebago Co Jail.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:06 p.m. Defendant Mackenzie R Ruppel in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position as to bond. Court orders $500 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:15 am.
